CD:
Enter specified folder
For example:
 - cd Bookmarks bar/Folder
 - cd ~/Other bookmarks
 - cd ../Bookmarks bar/Folder
LS:
List contents of current bookmark folder
For example:
 - ls -al
 - ls Bookmarks bar/
 - ls book
CP:
Copy a bookmark
For example:
 - cp Bookmark Name Folder/
MV:
Move a bookmark
For example:
 - mv Bookmark Name Folder/
FIND:
Search for a bookmark or tab.
Use asterisk as wildcard.
Use the -t flag to search open tabs.
Use the -i flag to return bookmark or tab IDs.
Use the -s flag specifies strict search mode.
For example:
 - find ~/Bookmarks bar/ *sea*term*
 - find -s *search term
 - find -i search term
 - find -t search term
TAB:
Manage Chrome tabs
Available actions are:
 - OPEN
 - CLOSE
 - NEW
 - LIST
 - INFO
 - ACTIVATE
For example:
 - tab open Bookmark name
 - tab list
 - tab info
Use -T flag to specify a tabgroup name
 - tab open -t "Group Name" Bookmark name
TABGROUP:
Manage tab groups
Available actions are:
 - NEW
 - LIST
For example:
 - tabgroup new Group Name
 - tabgroup ls
BOOKMARK:
Manage bookmarks
Available actions are:
 - OPEN
 - NEW
 - INFO
 - EDIT
